passage: Value-added tax (VAT) is a consumption tax levied on goods and services at each stage of the production and distribution process. It is usually paid by the consumer as a percentage of the retail price. VAT is widely adopted globally due to its revenue-generating potential and relative efficiency compared to other forms of taxation. Critics, however, argue that VAT can be regressive, disproportionately affecting lower-income individuals who spend a larger share of their income on goods and services.
question: Which choice best states the main idea of the text?

choices.A: The text explains how value-added tax disproportionately affects lower-income individuals and proposes alternative tax structures.
choices.B: The text focuses on the advantages of value-added tax, arguing that it is a superior form of taxation compared to others.
choices.C: The text provides an overview of value-added tax, discussing its structure, global adoption, and potential drawbacks.
choices.D: The text offers a historical perspective on the development and implementation of value-added tax systems around the world.

explanation: C: 'The text provides an overview of value-added tax, discussing its structure, global adoption, and potential drawbacks.' is the correct answer because the passage presents a brief introduction to VAT, mentions its widespread use, and points out a criticism related to its regressive nature.
distractor_explanation: 'The text focuses on the advantages of value-added tax, arguing that it is a superior form of taxation compared to others.' is incorrect because the text does not argue that VAT is superior to other forms of taxation, but rather presents a balanced overview.

'The text explains how value-added tax disproportionately affects lower-income individuals and proposes alternative tax structures.' is incorrect because the text does not propose alternative tax structures, but only mentions the regressive nature of VAT as a potential drawback.

'The text offers a historical perspective on the development and implementation of value-added tax systems around the world.' is incorrect because the passage does not discuss the history of VAT; it focuses on its structure and some of its characteristics.
